paragraph.paragraph:
Use the /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_SELECTION_flatshort.htmlDB_SELECTION class to select data from the database. Once you have selected the data, you can
../40_selection_access/index.xml access it with convenience using adaptative EiffelStore structures.
paragraph.note:
Note: Take a look at the
../50_data_object_coupling/index.xml Database/Eiffel objects Coupling if you need information about your database structure.
paragraph.paragraph: /libraries/store/reference/interface/DB_SELECTION_flatshort.htmlDB_SELECTION enables your application to get database content using SQL 'select' queries:

list.item:
You can carry out 'select' queries in an intuitive way using directly the SQL language:
selection: DB_SELECTION ... create selection.make selection.set_query ("select * from CONTACTS where firstname = 'John'") selection.execute
Tip: Always check the database status for errors after your 'select' query.

You can also customize your selection using
../60_query_variables/index.xml bind variables .
